item.title: Raising Visibility in the Digital Humanities Landscape: Academic Engagement and the Question of the Libraryâ€™s Role
item.author: Kathleen Kasten-Mutkus, Laura Costello, Darren Chase
item.description: Introduction The digital humanities are problematic to place. In his explanation of the visionary aspects of the digital humanities, Patrik Svensson1 suggests that the interdisciplinarity of the discipline disrupts traditional academic structures. Supporting digital humanities efforts requires an organizational and budgetary structure that universities, siloed into academic departments, are not equipped to support. The academic library, however, transcends some of these traditional boundaries and can be a setting for digital humanities encounters.
